intro: Trigonochilum cimiciferum, commonly known as the tickseed bluets, is a species of flowering plant in the family Violaceae. It is native to the southeastern United States, particularly Florida and parts of Georgia. The plant is characterized by its small, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in open woodlands. The leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in whorls around the stem, contributing to its ornamental appeal.
